sen.j: 宮城 豊盛（みやぎ とよもり、1554年（天文 (元号)23年） - 1620年（元和 (日本)6年））は、安土桃山時代から江戸時代までの武将。
sen.e: Toyomori MIYAGI (1554 - 1620), written as 宮城 豊盛 in Japanese, was a Japanese military commander who lived from the Azuchi-Momoyama period to the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 以下に名字の漢字について記載された文章があるため、漢字表記も訳文に残しました。
sen.e: Toyomori MIYAGI (1554 - 1620), written as 宮城 豊盛 in Japanese, was a Japanese military commander who lived from the Azuchi-Momoyama period to the Edo period.
Toyomori MIYAGI (1554 - 1620), written as 宮城 豊盛 in Japanese, was a Japanese military commander who lived from the Azuchi-Momoyama period to the Edo period.

sen.j: 宮木とも書かれるが、宮本と間違えられることもある。
sen.e: His family name is also written as 宮木 in Japanese, but some people write it as 宮本 by mistake.
His family name is also written as 宮木 in Japanese, but some people write it as 宮本 by mistake.
His family name is also written as 宮木 in Japanese, but some people write it as 宮本 by mistake.

sen.j: 通称、長次郎、長次ともいわれる。
sen.e: He was also generally called Chojiro or Choji.
He was also generally called Chojiro or Choji.
He was also generally called Chojiro or Choji.

sen.j: 宮城賢祐の養子で、豊臣秀吉に仕える。
sen.e: He was adopted by Katayoshi MIYAGI, and then he served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
He was adopted by Katayoshi MIYAGI, and then he served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
He was adopted by Katayoshi MIYAGI, and then he served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 慶長4年（1599年）従五位下丹波守に任官。
sen.e: In 1599, he was appointed the Tanba no kami (Governor of Tanba Province) with the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
In 1599, he was appointed Tanba no kami (Governor of Tanba Province) with the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
In 1599, he was appointed Tanba no kami (Governor of Tanba Province) with the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 文禄3年（1594年）には日田市・玖珠郡二万石（四万石とも）の蔵入地代官を務めた。
sen.e: In 1594, he was also appointed to be a local governor of a 20,000-koku (also it was said to have been 40,000 koku) kurairichi (land directly held by a daimyo) extending over Hita City and Kusu County.
In 1594, he was also appointed as a local governor of a 20,000-koku (also said to have been 40,000 koku) kurairichi (land directly held by a daimyo) extending over Hita City and Kusu County.
sen.cmt: to be → as. Also it was said → also said
sen.e: In 1594, he was also appointed as a local governor of a 20,000 koku (also said to have been 40,000 koku) kurairichi (land directly held by a daimyo) extending over Hita City and Kusu County.

sen.j: 慶長3年（1598年）慶長の役の最中に秀吉が没した後、徳川家康より命を受け、李氏朝鮮へ戦役中の将兵の撤兵を指導した。
sen.e: In 1598, after Hideyoshi died during the Keicho Campaign, he took charge of a withdrawal of officers and men who were at the front in Yi Dynasty Korea, by order of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.
In 1598, after Hideyoshi died during the Keicho Campaign, he took charge of the withdrawal of officers and men who were at the warfront in the Yi Dynasty of Korea, by order of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: a withdrawal → the withdrawal. The front in Yi Dynasty Korea → the warfront in the Yi Dynasty of Korea
sen.e: In 1598, after Hideyoshi died during the Keicho Campaign, he took charge of the withdrawal of officers and men who were at the warfront in the Yi Dynasty of Korea, by order of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 慶長5年（1600年）関ヶ原の戦いでは、石田三成方に付き敗戦後は、家康に所領を安堵されたことにより家康につく。
sen.e: In 1600, he took Mitsunari ISHIDA's side at the Battle of Sekigahara, but he went to Ieyasu's side after being defeated because Ieyasu guaranteed his territory.
In 1600, he fought on Mitsunari ISHIDA's side at the Battle of Sekigahara, but he went to fight on Ieyasu's side after being defeated because Ieyasu guaranteed him his territory.
sen.cmt: went on → fought on. Went on Ieyasu's side → went to fight on Ieyasu's side. Guaranteed his territory → guaranteed him his territory.
sen.e: In 1600, he fought on Mitsunari ISHIDA's side at the Battle of Sekigahara, but he went to fight on Ieyasu's side after being defeated because Ieyasu guaranteed him his territory.

sen.j: 元和5年（1619年）京都知恩院の普請奉行を務めている。
sen.e: In 1619, he was appointed as the Fushin Bugyo (Minister of Civil Engineering and Construction Office) of Chion-in Temple, which was located in Kyoto.
In 1619, he was appointed as the Fushin Bugyo (Minister of Civil Engineering and Construction Office) of Chion-in Temple, which was located in Kyoto.
In 1619, he was appointed as the Fushin Bugyo (Minister of Civil Engineering and Construction Office) of Chion-in Temple, which was located in Kyoto.

sen.j: 翌、同6年（1620年）京都にて67歳で没している。
sen.e: In 1620, he died at the age of 67 in Kyoto.
In 1620, he died at the age of 67 in Kyoto.
In 1620, he died at the age of 67 in Kyoto.
